cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 360 miles SSE of Lake Charles, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving WNW, forecast to turn NW then N-NW, making landfall along the southwest Louisiana–upper Texas coast before accelerating northeast across AR, TN and the lower Ohio Valley toward the Mid-Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southwest Louisiana / upper Texas coast (near Lake Charles – Port Arthur)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch east of Intracoastal City to west of Morgan City, LA; Storm-Surge Watch Freeport TX to San Luis Pass and Mouth of the Mississippi River to Ocean Springs MS
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning San Luis Pass TX to Intracoastal City LA; Storm-Surge Warning San Luis Pass TX to the Mouth of the Mississippi River; Tropical-Storm Warning Sargent TX to San Luis Pass and east of Intracoastal City LA to the Mouth of the Mississippi River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas coast, southwest and south-central Louisiana; later inland across Arkansas, Tennessee and the lower Ohio Valley
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusts 20–30 mph possible late Fri–Sat as the remnant low passes south of the port
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of tropical downpours possible Fri night–Sat; localized higher amounts south of the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief river-rise and minor flash-flood risk in low-lying areas; marginal tornado threat south of the port but very low directly at Ottawa
